Pre-Game Insights: David Warner has had a below-par start to what could be his final ODI World Cup appearance.
Adam Zampa has leaked runs in his two games with no wickets to his name.
Mitchell Starc might have recorded the feat of being the quickest to achieve 50 wickets in World Cup history, but it will mean for nothing if his side don't go on to lift their sixth title.
Travis Head has returned to nets having recovered from a fracture on his left hand, and the middle-order batter is expected to travel to India on Thursday to join his country's World Cup squad.
Dasun Shanaka's side then faced Pakistan in Hyderabad. Once again, despite a good batting performance, they ended up losing the game as Pakistan chased down a World Cup record target.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pat Cummins-led side lost to hosts India in their opening game at Chepauk in Chennai by six wickets.

The Aussies then faced another tough opposition in South Africa and despite winning the toss, the men from Down Under were bundled out for 177 as they lost back-to-back World Cup games for the first time since the 1992 edition.
Sri Lanka have also endured a poor start to their 2023 ODI Cricket World Cup campaign. They were thumped by the Proteas in Delhi.
Others: David Warner Vs Dunith Wellalage: David Warner will look to start afresh against Sri Lanka, but waiting in his wake would be Dunith Wellalage, who knows a thing or two about spinning the ball.
Adam Zampa Vs Kusal Mendis: Zampa, however, could face the wrath of an in-form Kusal Mendis, who has struck one fifty and one century in his two games.
Mitchell Starc Vs Sadeera Samarawickrama: Sadeera Samarawickrama scored a well-made 108 against Pakistan and thus, his battle with Starc makes it even more interesting.
